title: Brazilian president says oil spills appear to be criminal
text:
RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) - Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro says the oil spills that have been contaminating the northeastern coast since the beginning of September appear to involve crimes.

Bolsonaro said on Tuesday that "it seems that something was dumped criminally." But he declined to say who authorities suspect to be behind the leak.

Environment Minister Ricardo Salles has said the spills eventually reached 42 municipalities in several states. Salles says over 100 tons of oil have been cleaned up.

State oil company Petrobras says the spilled oil isn't from Brazil, but is from a single source.
